title: Drugs in Cobb home visible from outside, police say; resident arrested
title_page: Drugs in Cobb home visible from outside, police say; resident arrested
text:
A Cobb County mother was concerned about who was coming and going from a home near hers.
“You don’t want your kids running around playing in the yard,” she said, “when someone’s doing things like that.”
Andra Weathersby (Credit: Cobb County Sheriff’s Office)
On Sunday night, police arrested Andra Weathersby, 42, at a house on Brownsville Road in Powder Springs, Channel 2 Action News reported. He’s in the Cobb County jail without bond.
Investigators said he had cocaine and marijuana in the house, and that the drugs were visible from outside. They have not said how Weathersby got the bruises on his face and a black eye.
In searching the house, officers also found scales and plastic bags and think Weathersby planned to distribute the drugs, according to Channel 2.
Neighbors said they saw police cruisers at the house Sunday evening, so they knew something was up. But there was never a lot of foot traffic at the house in the year or so that the tenants were in the house..
“Whatever he was doing,” said Kayla Delay, a resident in the neighborhood, “it wasn’t coming to him, he was going to it.”
